stem: A child has fallen on an outstretched hand and flexed elbow. On examination, there is a swelling around the elbow with an absent radial pulse. Which of the following is the best management option?
opt2: Closed reduction while monitoring the radial pulse
disc:
A child with supracondylar fracture presents with pain, swelling, and restriction of motion around the elbow after falling on an outstretched hand.

In children with distal vascular compromise, immediate open reduction and vascular repair should be performed.
